column5: It was such a beautiful day today... I had to put everything on "hold" this afternoon and take the boat out.  Twas 64*F and light winds... for about 30 minutes after I was on the water  The main agenda for today was this:  Relaxation!!!  I didn't even hit the dam, because that would have been too much work casting!  Drowning minnows and lookin' for Mr. Crappie was today's task... never did find Mr. Crappie!  ... but these "spots" wanted to play!  I caught all but 1 on my homemade Cabela's wobble jig (1/8th oz.) and a 5" plastic grub.   A little cutie pie!   A little bigger   Just slightly larger than the one above   Biggest "jig" fish of the day   This one couldn't resist the live minnow on the Sabiki rig!  As you can see, the wind got up a little and it turned freezin' cold... so I had to put on a long sleeve shirt!  It was a nice 4 hrs. on the water!
Great report and pics Glen  Looked like you had some time to relax and catch a few Nice spots Thanks for sharing Jacques
Good for you Glen!   Glad to see you out for some fishing. Keep those open water pics and fishing reports coming. Its a long time here until April.
Very nice, Glen, you is makin us a little jealous.
Nice job GCD. Thanks for sharing.
Thanks for the report GCD. I'm already going crazy waiting to take my kayak out again. Those spots are some pretty fish, too bad we don't have them up here.
Thanks for the report. Looks nice down your way. Now I've got some more ammunition to bug the wife with. Been trying to convince her of another winter road trip.
This is all wrong you freak!  There's ashes falling in the poor fishes mouth! and What Are You Doing With That Finger?  Do you only target fish whose patterns match your shirt?  Appalling
Yer a jealous bee-yatch, and you still can't have my shirt!!!
Hey dat's a shnazzy shirt bud.  You make the nineties look good.  Did you cook any them godduns up?  HD
Well if it means anything to you......this was today at my favourite lake    Break out the augers boys and girls!!!  Sinker
You did good Glen. Glad you were able to get out for some R&R. What's the spots' main menu there, shiners?

Great report Glen!!....64F eh???....now that's balmy weather compared to the -13C up around these neck of the woods this morning   .......No skin pics????  I finally pulled the pontoon boat out of the river    was a sad day!!.....but, now I'll put the 14' Smokercraft in until ice up  ....here's a shot of what the weather's like...    Steve
Geeze......you should turn that dock into a goose blind!!  Wheres the ice?  Sinker
Looks like a nice relaxing day.  Wish I was there to join you.  Alas, I must go shovel my driveway  Nice spots G  Joey
Nice Glen......showing all that lovely warm sunshine and fish.......you are just cruel  Good looking spots and it appears that the outing was a success.

Oh sure....I read this when it's -9C outside (-17C with the wind chill).  Nice fish...so sorry you had to put on a sweater....poor you...LOL.  Keep posting thru the long winter Glen....keeps me looking towards spring!!!!
No ice yet Sinker....I've been pretty lucky with the north winds lately....it's keepin a good chop on the water day and night....hopefully I won't see ice until the Muskie season closes in December
Glen, Can you throw your parka on,once in a while. It would make use hosiers feel a little bit better.
Some nice looking Green trout GCD...........
